author: jessie scanlon
text: the history of special effects has been, to a large extent, one long bad-hair day. aliens attack, the terminator terminates, and dinosaurs ravage jurassic park with relative ease, but hair that looks like hair has been an elusive cg goal - one that disney's christmas offering,  mighty joe young, seems to have reached. improving upon now-patented software developed for jumanji, industrial light & magic effects whiz jim mitchell was able to specify the length, texture, and color of each strand, plus where it should bend and reflect scene details like wind and lighting. with the variables set, the program automatically adjusted each individual hair as mighty joe moved.electric wordmillennium timepiecemutant marshlandsthe defender(b)rush hour
